bug.author: Siegelcpp
bug.summary: ImportError: cannot import name '_ciphey_core_py' from partially initialized module 'cipheycore'
bug.description: I installed ciphey under macos 10.15.5 and encountered such an error. How to solve it? I installed it according to the steps in the document. <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/44493013/88356466-7c29e700-cd9a-11ea-8e5b-c22eca8a76c9.png></denchmark-link>

comments.comment: Issue Label Bot is not confident enough to auto-label this issue. See <denchmark-link:https://mlbot.net/data/Ciphey/Ciphey>dashboard</denchmark-link> for more details.
Hey! Can you try installing Ciphey's release candidate? python3 -m pip instal lciphey==5.0.0rc9 :D

Just a note: I am having problems building cipheycore for macos python 3.7. If the problem persists with the rc, try running on python 3.8 (if possible). I am in the process of overhauling the build system (again), as windows builds are completely failing

嘿! 您可以尝试安装Ciphey的候选发行版吗？ python3 -m pip instal lciphey==5.0.0rc9 ：D
Thanks for your suggestion, I have tried it and it still doesn't work
嘿! 您可以尝试安装Ciphey的候选发行版吗？ python3 -m pip instal lciphey==5.0.0rc9 ：D
Thank you for your suggestions, I have tried it and it still doesn’t work. Looking forward to your updates, this is a very promising tool
I have fixed macos builds for python versions 3.7 and 3.8. Installing the latest ciphey (v5.0.0rc10) should give you something that works better
This is pretty cool, thanks for the update and I'll build it right away

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/Siegelcpp>@Siegelcpp</denchmark-link> We've just pushed version 5 (), which definitely should not have this problem. Please feel free to reopen this issue if we have screwed up and this still exists there!
